p: The results showed that WBC, N, RDW, NLR, and PLR increased significantly in the influenza virus infection group compared with the healthy control ( P < .01 for all), while L, RBC, Hb, PLT, and PNR decreased ( P < .01 for all) (Table 1). Specifically, the sensitivity of NLR detection was higher than the common systemic inflammatory markers, including neutrophils and lymphocytes (Table 2). No significant differences were found between influenza virus A and B.
